channel.title: Turing Language
channel.description:
So, who uses it?
Download link incase your wondering what this is: http://compsci.ca/blog/download-turing-411/
Now, Turing is a basic program which basically runs notepad, just with a built in "run", "compile" etc, and help topics on how to fix things.
Turing is used in many schools as a programming technique that is easy to understand and use, instead of learning c and java which could take years to master.
Here is another link to a description: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turing_(programming_language)
So once again, has anyone used this or even heard of this? If so, discuss your experience of it, no flaming, as there shouldn't be any at all, or i will get this locked most likely.
Extra- Instead of making another thread (not being lazy, just going to make this easier seeming ill filter out the people who don't know what i'm using etc w.e).
Ok so for everyone who has used Turing, or thinks they can help fix ths by all means, try it.
[code]here is the code, and the problem is, if the enemy goes on your x axis line, or y axis line, they bounce off, i realize what is wrong ( i didnt save my other attempt), because i want the enemies to only bounce off you if your exact co ordinates = theirs, but my otehr attempt, basically combiing the two methods i used here, made the enemies go right through me, not affecting hp, speed or nothing.
%//////////////////////BounceOffPlayer\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\% if enemyX (5) = x then xChange (5) := -xChange (5) health := health - 25 xChange (5) := 15
end if if enemyX (4) = x then xChange (4) := -xChange (4) health := health - 25 xChange (4) := 15
end if if enemyX (3) = x then xChange (3) := -xChange (3) health := health - 25 xChange (3) := 15
end if if enemyX (2) = x then xChange (2) := -xChange (2) health := health - 25 xChange (2) := 15
end if if enemyX (1) = x then xChange (1) := -xChange (1) health := health - 25 xChange (1) := 15
end if if enemyY (5) = y then yChange (5) := -yChange (5) health := health - 25 yChange (5) := 15
end if if enemyY (4) = y then yChange (4) := -yChange (4) health := health - 25 yChange (4) := 15
end if if enemyY (3) = y then yChange (3) := -yChange (3) health := health - 25 yChange (3) := 15
end if if enemyY (2) = y then yChange (2) := -yChange (2) health := health - 25 yChange (2) := 15
end if if enemyY (1) = y then yChange (1) := -yChange (1) health := health - 25 yChange (1) := 15 end if[/code]
EnemyY(INT) is basically, enemy 1,or 2,3,4,5 etc and im pretty sure the rest is self explanitory.

item.title: Turing Language
item.dc:creator: @RSPS_Master1 RSPS Master
item.description:
@RSPS_Master1 wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:3, topic:301309”]Look’s more complicated than Java to be honest.

that’s only cause your so familiar with java ;P[/quote]

This is true. Each time you learn a new scripting language, it slowly takes over your mind. Slowly wiping any memory of other scripting languages away.
(or it may be that you only learned one scripting language. Either way its the same thing)

Read full topic

item.title: Turing Language
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

So, who uses it?

Download link incase your wondering what this is: http://compsci.ca/blog/download-turing-411/

Now, Turing is a basic program which basically runs notepad, just with a built in “run”, “compile” etc, and help topics on how to fix things.

Turing is used in many schools as a programming technique that is easy to understand and use, instead of learning c and java which could take years to master.

Here is another link to a description:

en.wikipedia.org

Turing (programming language)

Turing is a Pascal-like programming language developed in 1982 by Ric Holt and James Cordy, then of University of Toronto, in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Turing is a descendant of Euclid, Pascal and SP/k that features a clean syntax and precise machine-independent semantics. Turing 4.1.0 is the latest stable version of Turing. Turing 4.1.1 and Turing 4.1.2 do not allow for stand alone .EXE files to be created and versions before Turing 4.1.0 have outdated syntax and outdated functions. Named afte...

So once again, has anyone used this or even heard of this? If so, discuss your experience of it, no flaming, as there shouldn’t be any at all, or i will get this locked most likely.

Extra- Instead of making another thread (not being lazy, just going to make this easier seeming ill filter out the people who don’t know what i’m using etc w.e).

Ok so for everyone who has used Turing, or thinks they can help fix ths by all means, try it.

[code]here is the code, and the problem is, if the enemy goes on your x axis line, or y axis line, they bounce off, i realize what is wrong ( i didnt save my other attempt), because i want the enemies to only bounce off you if your exact co ordinates = theirs, but my otehr attempt, basically combiing the two methods i used here, made the enemies go right through me, not affecting hp, speed or nothing.

    %//////////////////////BounceOffPlayer\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\%
    if enemyX (5) = x then
        xChange (5) := -xChange (5)
        health := health - 25
        xChange (5) := 15

    end if
    if enemyX (4) = x then
        xChange (4) := -xChange (4)
        health := health - 25
        xChange (4) := 15

    end if
    if enemyX (3) = x then
        xChange (3) := -xChange (3)
        health := health - 25
        xChange (3) := 15

    end if
    if enemyX (2) = x then
        xChange (2) := -xChange (2)
        health := health - 25
        xChange (2) := 15

    end if
    if enemyX (1) = x then
        xChange (1) := -xChange (1)
        health := health - 25
        xChange (1) := 15

    end if
    if enemyY (5) = y then
        yChange (5) := -yChange (5)
        health := health - 25
        yChange (5) := 15

    end if
    if enemyY (4) = y then
        yChange (4) := -yChange (4)
        health := health - 25
        yChange (4) := 15

    end if
    if enemyY (3) = y then
        yChange (3) := -yChange (3)
        health := health - 25
        yChange (3) := 15

    end if
    if enemyY (2) = y then
        yChange (2) := -yChange (2)
        health := health - 25
        yChange (2) := 15

    end if
    if enemyY (1) = y then
        yChange (1) := -yChange (1)
        health := health - 25
        yChange (1) := 15
    end if[/code]

EnemyY(INT) is basically, enemy 1,or 2,3,4,5 etc and im pretty sure the rest is self explanitory.

Read full topic
